----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Class : ApplicationPage
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This ApplicationPage is the base page that contains Globalization logic as well as functionality to display messages and save session information that is available to the application.
NOTE: This page is used by Default.aspx (default login page), Calendar and other Renaissance Architect forms.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : Core.Windows.UI Class : Web.UI.FieldObjectBase
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Container for all visual web controls that are generated in CORE's applications.
The FieldObjectBase is the base class used for the Renaissance Architect server controls.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores whether the Display method was executed on this field during the current postback.
This value is set internally by the framework and indicates that during the current postback, the Display method was executed on the current field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that this field is receiving focus due to an Accept, RequestPrompt method.
The SetAcceptRequestPrompt property is set internally by the framework. It is used to ensure that the proper postback event is generated for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that this field is an Accept field on a named designer.
The IsDesignerAccept property is used to indicate that an Accept method is used on this field using a named designer procedure. This ensures that the field becomes enabled during the execution of the designer.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that a Request/Prompt was performed on the current field.
The RequestWasPerformed property is used internally to indicate that a Request/Prompt method was executed against the current field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value for PromptOK for the first request.
The RequestPromptOK property indicates the PromptOK value for the first request performed during a given iteration. Subsequent Requests executed will use this value for PromptOK.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- FieldID ------------------------------------------------------------
The numbered designer that executes on this field. (ie. Designer_02).
A String containing the ID of the current Field.
Use the FieldID property to indicate which default designer procedure will execute against a specific field. Multiple fields with the same FieldID value will be executed as a block. For screens without a grid, this property will be blank if no numbered designer procedure is coded.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value that is currently in the field and uses this value as the OldValue.
The SubmittedValue property is used internally by the framework. This property stores the value that was entered in the field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value that was in submitted value to replace an invalid value if an error occurs (using the ErrorMessage or Severe methods).
The OldSubmittedValue property is used internally by the framework. This property resets the value to the field if an error is thrown (using the ErrorMessage or Severe methods).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value that was entered in the field in Find mode using the RequestPrompt method.
The RequestValue property is used internally by the framework. This property stores the Request value that was entered during the Find phase. Subsequent Requests during this Find iteration will use this value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- FieldName ----------------------------------------------------------
Variable name or element name of the field. For elements, this will be in the format TableName.ElementName.
A String containing the variable or element name to assign to control.
Use the FieldName property to set the name of the field using the variable or element name. For fields that are based on elements from the database, the syntax will be Tablename.ElementName. This property is used to retrieve the appropriate dictionary information (only for elements).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Refresh ----------------------------------------------------------
If Refresh is set to True the field will Refresh after a runscreen call.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
TableName of the control.
The TableName property is used internally in the framework, and is determined from the FieldName property. This property will be blank if the field is based on a variable, and will contain the name of the table if the field is based on an element in the database.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dictionary element used by this control. This is a Read-Only property.
The Dictionary property is used internally by the framework to indicate the dictionary element to use for this field. This value is dependant on the value in FieldName, and is blank if the field is based on a variable.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- DataType -----------------------------------------------------------
DataType of the field (Character, Numeric or Date).
One of the allowable DataTypes, either a Character, Numeric or Date.
Use the Datatype property to indicate how the field should be validated and formatted.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- InputScale --------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the input scale to use for entered values (numeric fields only).
A String representing a numeric value.
Use the InputScale property to set the scaling factor that is to be used when values are entered for numeric items.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If set to True, applies scaling defined on "InputScale" and "OutputScale", this setting will override the Application Level Setting "UseScaling".
The default value is "UseDefault" which will use Application Level Setting "UseScaling".
[Mayur] 06/24/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- OutputScale --------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the output scaling to use for displayed values (numeric fields only).
A String representing a numeric value.
Use the OutputScale property to set the output scaling factor. The value to be displayed will be scaled by this factor.
This property can only be applied to numeric fields.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the range(s) of acceptable values for a field.
Example: A-D,H-L
1-10,15,20
The Values property is used internally by the framework. The FieldValues property (which has validation code) is used as the basis for this property. This property uses a RangeList to allow easy access to the values stored.
Use the FieldValues property to set the specified values.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- FieldValues -------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the range(s) of acceptable values for a field.
A String representing a range of values.
Use the FieldValues property to list a set of valid values that can be entered into the current field. The value entered by the user will then be checked against this list to verify that a valid value was entered.
A-D,H-L
1-10,15,20
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- BWZ ---------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that the field should be displayed as a blank when the value in the field is zero.
One of the BooleanTypes. If value is "NotSet" then the value will be taken from the dictionary if one exists.
Use the BWZ (Blank When Zero) property to suppress displaying the value in the field if the value is zero. This is valid for numeric fields only.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AutoNext ---------------------------------------------------------------
Move to the next field when input size of the field is reached. field is complete.
One of the BooleanTypes. If value is "NotSet" then the value will be taken from the dictionary if one exists.
Use the AutoNext property to move the cursor to the next field when the current one is filled
[Glenn] 8/28/2007 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- UseDictionary ---------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that temporary field should use dictionary field of that same name. field is complete.
One of the BooleanTypes. Default is False.
Use the AutoNext property to move the cursor to the next field when the current one is filled
[GlennA] 29-Oct-2007 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ShiftType ----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates whether the value entered should be changed to uppercase, lowercase or left as is.
One of the ShiftTypes. If value is "NotSet" then the value will be taken from the dictionary if one exists.
Use the ShiftType property to Upshift, Downshift or leave the value as is (NoShift).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- LeadingSign -------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a single character that is placed to the left of the most significant digit to indicate that the numeric value of the field is a negative number.
A String representing the character to be used to indicate a negative number.
Use the LeadingSign property to display the leading sign character to the left of the most significant digit in order to indicate that the value displayed is a negative number.
Sufficient substitution characters (^) or non-submstitution characters must be added to the Picture if the picture property is used.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Fill -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the character used to 'fill' unused space to the left of the most significant digit.
A String representing the character to be used to fill in the unused space.
Use the Fill property to set the character that is to be used to fill unused space to the left of the most significant digit.
Float character and Leading sign must be taken into account.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Float --------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the float character to appear to the left of the most significant digit.
A String representing the float character to be displayed.
Use the Float property to set the character that will be displayed to the left of the most significant digit (ie. $ for currency fields).
Sufficient substitution characters (^) must be added to the Picture if the picture property is used.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- TrailingSign -------------------------------------------------------
Specifies up to 2 characters that are placed to the right most digit to indicate that the numeric value of the field is a negative number.
A String representing the characters to be displayed.
Use the TrailingSign property to set the character(s) that will be displayed to the right most digit to indicate that the vlaue of the field is a negative number.
Sufficient nonsubstitution characters (^) must be added to the Picture if the picture property is used.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Required ----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that a value is required for this field when entering a new record.
A Boolean Type indicating if this field is required or not. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may be found in the dictionary.
Use the Required property to indicate that this field requires a value when entering new records.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Choose ----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that this field is a Choose field.
A Boolean value indicating if this field is a Choose or not.
This property should only be used on the ParmPrompt screen.
[Chris] 09/05/2007 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Display ------------------------------------------------------------
Displays the control as read-only in Entry, Find or Change mode.
One of the Behavior types representing the mode. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may be found in the dictionary.
Use the Display property to indicate that this field should be a read-only field during the Find/Entry/Change phases.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Omit ---------------------------------------------------------------
States that the data on the screen cannot be entered or displayed on the screen unless forced through procedural code.
One of the Behavior types representing the mode. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may be found in the dictionary.
Use the Omit property to hide the field during the Find/Entry/Change phases.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Fixed --------------------------------------------------------------
Permanently displays the current value for this field when the screen first appears.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Fixed property to indicate that the value of the screen is displayed when the screen first appears. This field is also not updatable by default unless forced through procedural code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Fixed --------------------------------------------------------------
Permanently displays the current value for this field when the screen first appears.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Fixed property to indicate that the value of the screen is displayed when the screen first appears. This field is also not updatable by default unless forced through procedural code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Silent -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that the field should not appear on the screen.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Silent property to hide a field on the screen. This option is used for processing purposes when used in conjunction with a block other fields.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Hidden -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that the field should be invisible on the screen.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Hidden property to hide a field on the screen.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoChange -----------------------------------------------------------
Permits the user to only enter a value when in Entry mode.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoChange property to disallow the user from changing the value in this field for existing records. This field allows data entry when adding new records.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoCorrect ----------------------------------------------------------
States that once a value has been entered in Entry mode, it cannot be changed until the record has been saved.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoCorrect property to set the field to read-only during Correct mode. This means that once the Entry sequence has completed, this value cannot be changed until the record has been saved.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoEntry ------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that this field is read-only in Entry mode.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoEntry property in order to set this field to read-only during Entry mode.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoSelect -----------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that this field is read-only in Select (Find) mode.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoSelect property to set this field to read-only during Select (Find) mode.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PreDisplay ---------------------------------------------------------
Display any initial value for this field as soon as the screen appears, or if the mode is changed, or if the cluster is initialized.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the PreDisplay property to indicate that the value should be displayed as soon as the screen appears, when the mode is changed, or the cluster is initialized.
Assumed for ALL fields on a slave screen.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoWarn -------------------------------------------------------------
Suppresses the display of messages.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoWarn property to indicate that no messages should be displayed on the screen.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Default ------------------------------------------------------------
The default value to be used when in Entry mode and no item has previously been entered into the field.
A String containing the field's default value.
Use the Default property to set the value that is to be used as the default value for this field if the user doesn't enter anything into this field during Entry processing. If Required is also set to True, the Default option is ignored.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- EntryIf ------------------------------------------------------------
Field is required in Entry mode if the specified condition is met.
A String containing the condition to be met.
Use the EntryIf property to indicate that a value is to be entered into this field only if the current condition is met during Entry processing.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Pattern ------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a string of characters and metacharacters that provides a general description of values.
A String containing the general description of values.
Use the Pattern property to st the string of characters and metacharacters that provides a pattern that the entered data must adhere to in order to be valid.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Picture ------------------------------------------------------------
Establishes the output picture to be used to format the item value for display.
A String containing the output picture format.
Use the Picture property to set the format that is to be used to display the value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Significance -------------------------------------------------------
Establishes the minimum number of decimal points to be displayed.
A String representing the number of decimal points.
Use the Significance property to set the minimum number of decimal points to be displayed. It is used to display leading non-substitution characters and leading zeros.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- UnderLyingDataType -------------------------------------------------
DataType of the underlying item (variable or element) for this field.
One of the DataTypes. The default value is "NotSet".
The datatype can be one of Character, Numeric or Date. The default value is initialized to "NotSet" meaning the property has not been set or the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

This property differs from the ValueChanged property in that ValueChanged stays persistent throughout the current mode, while this property is keeps it's value only until after the Validation is run. Once a new control has the Accept focus, this value is reset. This is used to determine whether to use the value from the Text property versus the SubmittedValue property.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Input event handles data conversion for a value entered prior to editing.
The Input event can be used to change the value (or lack of value) entered by the user. The predefined member variable FieldText is used to determine the value entered by the user, and this value can be changed prior to editing. This event is called after being prompted in a field based on the Accept or RequestPrompt method.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Output event handles performing data conversion prior to displaying the value in a field.
The Output event can be used to change data prior to displaying the value. This event is raised prior to the application of formatting options. It is raised in response to the Accept, RequestPrompt or Display methods. In order to change the value, the predefined member variable FieldText must be altered. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Process event performs processing after a value was entered.
The Process event is used to perform additional processing such as performing calculations and is initiated based on an entered value as a result of the Accept or Edit methods. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue (numeric or date fields) to update the current value. Referencing the underlying record buffers (ie. the value from the associated File class or Temporary class) is not recommended as the FieldText or FieldValue values have already been moved into those record buffers during the validation phase (as a result of the Accept or Edit methods), and may therefore not be current. The Process event is executed after the successful completion of the Edit event. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Edit event performs editing on a value in a field.
The Edit event can be is used to perform editing of values. This event is initiated as a result of being called during the validation process of the Edit method, or as a result of an entered or changed value entered in a field in response to the Accept method. During the processing phase of the Accept method, Edit event is raised if the predefined member variable FieldText is not empty at the end of the Input event. Default values also do not trigger the Edit event. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue to compare the current value with existing or old values. To access the old value, use the OldValue function.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The LookupOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value exists.
Use the LookupOn event to handle logic for checking if the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to not finding a matching value.
In the example below, if the MANAGER record is found, then the fleMANAGER class will now contain this record. This record will now be used when referencing a value from the fleMANAGER class until a new retrieval is performed.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" MANAGER.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
fleMANAGER.GetData(strSQL.ToString, GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
If Not AccessOk Then
Warning("This manager does not exist.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- LookupNotOn --------------------------------------------------------
The LookupNotOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value does not exist.
Use the LookupNotOn event to handle logic for checking that the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to finding a matching value.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim blnAlreadyExists As Boolean
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("SELECT EMPLOYEE_ID ")
strSQL.Append(" FROM ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE ")
strSQL.Append(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
Dim rdr As OracleDataReader = OracleHelper.ExecuteReader(m_trnTRANS_UPDATE, CommandType.Text, strSQL.ToString)
If rdr.Read OrElse Not LookupNotOn(fleEMPLOYEE, "EMPLOYEE_ID", FIELDTEXT) Then
blnAlreadyExists = True
End If
rdr.Close()
rdr.Dispose()
If blnAlreadyExists Then
ErrorMessage("This EMPLOYEE record already exists.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Input event handles data conversion for a value entered prior to editing.
The Input event can be used to change the value (or lack of value) entered by the user. The predefined member variable FieldText is used to determine the value entered by the user, and this value can be changed prior to editing. This event is called after being prompted in a field based on the Accept or RequestPrompt method.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Output event handles performing data conversion prior to displaying the value in a field.
The Output event can be used to change data prior to displaying the value. This event is raised prior to the application of formatting options. It is raised in response to the Accept, RequestPrompt or Display methods. In order to change the value, the predefined member variable FieldText must be altered. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Process event performs processing after a value was entered.
The Process event is used to perform additional processing such as performing calculations and is initiated based on an entered value as a result of the Accept or Edit methods. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue (numeric or date fields) to update the current value. Referencing the underlying record buffers (ie. the value from the associated File class or Temporary class) is not recommended as the FieldText or FieldValue values have already been moved into those record buffers during the validation phase (as a result of the Accept or Edit methods), and may therefore not be current. The Process event is executed after the successful completion of the Edit event. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Edit event performs editing on a value in a field.
The Edit event can be is used to perform editing of values. This event is initiated as a result of being called during the validation process of the Edit method, or as a result of an entered or changed value entered in a field in response to the Accept method. During the processing phase of the Accept method, Edit event is raised if the predefined member variable FieldText is not empty at the end of the Input event. Default values also do not trigger the Edit event. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue to compare the current value with existing or old values. To access the old value, use the OldValue function.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The LookupOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value exists.
Use the LookupOn event to handle logic for checking if the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to not finding a matching value.
In the example below, if the MANAGER record is found, then the fleMANAGER class will now contain this record. This record will now be used when referencing a value from the fleMANAGER class until a new retrieval is performed.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" MANAGER.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
fleMANAGER.GetData(strSQL.ToString, GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
If Not AccessOk Then
Warning("This manager does not exist.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- LookupNotOn --------------------------------------------------------
The LookupNotOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value does not exist.
Use the LookupNotOn event to handle logic for checking that the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to finding a matching value.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim blnAlreadyExists As Boolean
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("SELECT EMPLOYEE_ID ")
strSQL.Append(" FROM ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE ")
strSQL.Append(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
Dim rdr As OracleDataReader = OracleHelper.ExecuteReader(m_trnTRANS_UPDATE, CommandType.Text, strSQL.ToString)
If rdr.Read OrElse Not LookupNotOn(fleEMPLOYEE, "EMPLOYEE_ID", FIELDTEXT) Then
blnAlreadyExists = True
End If
rdr.Close()
rdr.Dispose()
If blnAlreadyExists Then
ErrorMessage("This EMPLOYEE record already exists.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : Core.Windows.UI Class : Web.UI.FieldObjectBase
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Container for all visual web controls that are generated in CORE's applications.
The FieldObjectBase is the base class used for the Renaissance Architect server controls.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores whether the Display method was executed on this field during the current postback.
This value is set internally by the framework and indicates that during the current postback, the Display method was executed on the current field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that this field is receiving focus due to an Accept, RequestPrompt method.
The SetAcceptRequestPrompt property is set internally by the framework. It is used to ensure that the proper postback event is generated for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that this field is an Accept field on a named designer.
The IsDesignerAccept property is used to indicate that an Accept method is used on this field using a named designer procedure. This ensures that the field becomes enabled during the execution of the designer.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that a Request/Prompt was performed on the current field.
The RequestWasPerformed property is used internally to indicate that a Request/Prompt method was executed against the current field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value for PromptOK for the first request.
The RequestPromptOK property indicates the PromptOK value for the first request performed during a given iteration. Subsequent Requests executed will use this value for PromptOK.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- FieldID ------------------------------------------------------------
The numbered designer that executes on this field. (ie. Designer_02).
A String containing the ID of the current Field.
Use the FieldID property to indicate which default designer procedure will execute against a specific field. Multiple fields with the same FieldID value will be executed as a block. For screens without a grid, this property will be blank if no numbered designer procedure is coded.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value that is currently in the field and uses this value as the OldValue.
The SubmittedValue property is used internally by the framework. This property stores the value that was entered in the field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value that was in submitted value to replace an invalid value if an error occurs (using the ErrorMessage or Severe methods).
The OldSubmittedValue property is used internally by the framework. This property resets the value to the field if an error is thrown (using the ErrorMessage or Severe methods).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value that was entered in the field in Find mode using the RequestPrompt method.
The RequestValue property is used internally by the framework. This property stores the Request value that was entered during the Find phase. Subsequent Requests during this Find iteration will use this value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- FieldName ----------------------------------------------------------
Variable name or element name of the field. For elements, this will be in the format TableName.ElementName.
A String containing the variable or element name to assign to control.
Use the FieldName property to set the name of the field using the variable or element name. For fields that are based on elements from the database, the syntax will be Tablename.ElementName. This property is used to retrieve the appropriate dictionary information (only for elements).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Refresh ----------------------------------------------------------
If Refresh is set to True the field will Refresh after a runscreen call.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
TableName of the control.
The TableName property is used internally in the framework, and is determined from the FieldName property. This property will be blank if the field is based on a variable, and will contain the name of the table if the field is based on an element in the database.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dictionary element used by this control. This is a Read-Only property.
The Dictionary property is used internally by the framework to indicate the dictionary element to use for this field. This value is dependant on the value in FieldName, and is blank if the field is based on a variable.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- DataType -----------------------------------------------------------
DataType of the field (Character, Numeric or Date).
One of the allowable DataTypes, either a Character, Numeric or Date.
Use the Datatype property to indicate how the field should be validated and formatted.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- InputScale --------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the input scale to use for entered values (numeric fields only).
A String representing a numeric value.
Use the InputScale property to set the scaling factor that is to be used when values are entered for numeric items.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If set to True, applies scaling defined on "InputScale" and "OutputScale", this setting will override the Application Level Setting "UseScaling".
The default value is "UseDefault" which will use Application Level Setting "UseScaling".
[Mayur] 06/24/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- OutputScale --------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the output scaling to use for displayed values (numeric fields only).
A String representing a numeric value.
Use the OutputScale property to set the output scaling factor. The value to be displayed will be scaled by this factor.
This property can only be applied to numeric fields.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the range(s) of acceptable values for a field.
Example: A-D,H-L
1-10,15,20
The Values property is used internally by the framework. The FieldValues property (which has validation code) is used as the basis for this property. This property uses a RangeList to allow easy access to the values stored.
Use the FieldValues property to set the specified values.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- FieldValues -------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the range(s) of acceptable values for a field.
A String representing a range of values.
Use the FieldValues property to list a set of valid values that can be entered into the current field. The value entered by the user will then be checked against this list to verify that a valid value was entered.
A-D,H-L
1-10,15,20
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- BWZ ---------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that the field should be displayed as a blank when the value in the field is zero.
One of the BooleanTypes. If value is "NotSet" then the value will be taken from the dictionary if one exists.
Use the BWZ (Blank When Zero) property to suppress displaying the value in the field if the value is zero. This is valid for numeric fields only.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AutoNext ---------------------------------------------------------------
Move to the next field when input size of the field is reached. field is complete.
One of the BooleanTypes. If value is "NotSet" then the value will be taken from the dictionary if one exists.
Use the AutoNext property to move the cursor to the next field when the current one is filled
[Glenn] 8/28/2007 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- UseDictionary ---------------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that temporary field should use dictionary field of that same name. field is complete.
One of the BooleanTypes. Default is False.
Use the AutoNext property to move the cursor to the next field when the current one is filled
[GlennA] 29-Oct-2007 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ShiftType ----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates whether the value entered should be changed to uppercase, lowercase or left as is.
One of the ShiftTypes. If value is "NotSet" then the value will be taken from the dictionary if one exists.
Use the ShiftType property to Upshift, Downshift or leave the value as is (NoShift).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- LeadingSign -------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a single character that is placed to the left of the most significant digit to indicate that the numeric value of the field is a negative number.
A String representing the character to be used to indicate a negative number.
Use the LeadingSign property to display the leading sign character to the left of the most significant digit in order to indicate that the value displayed is a negative number.
Sufficient substitution characters (^) or non-submstitution characters must be added to the Picture if the picture property is used.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Fill -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the character used to 'fill' unused space to the left of the most significant digit.
A String representing the character to be used to fill in the unused space.
Use the Fill property to set the character that is to be used to fill unused space to the left of the most significant digit.
Float character and Leading sign must be taken into account.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Float --------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the float character to appear to the left of the most significant digit.
A String representing the float character to be displayed.
Use the Float property to set the character that will be displayed to the left of the most significant digit (ie. $ for currency fields).
Sufficient substitution characters (^) must be added to the Picture if the picture property is used.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- TrailingSign -------------------------------------------------------
Specifies up to 2 characters that are placed to the right most digit to indicate that the numeric value of the field is a negative number.
A String representing the characters to be displayed.
Use the TrailingSign property to set the character(s) that will be displayed to the right most digit to indicate that the vlaue of the field is a negative number.
Sufficient nonsubstitution characters (^) must be added to the Picture if the picture property is used.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Required ----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that a value is required for this field when entering a new record.
A Boolean Type indicating if this field is required or not. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may be found in the dictionary.
Use the Required property to indicate that this field requires a value when entering new records.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Choose ----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates that this field is a Choose field.
A Boolean value indicating if this field is a Choose or not.
This property should only be used on the ParmPrompt screen.
[Chris] 09/05/2007 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Display ------------------------------------------------------------
Displays the control as read-only in Entry, Find or Change mode.
One of the Behavior types representing the mode. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may be found in the dictionary.
Use the Display property to indicate that this field should be a read-only field during the Find/Entry/Change phases.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Omit ---------------------------------------------------------------
States that the data on the screen cannot be entered or displayed on the screen unless forced through procedural code.
One of the Behavior types representing the mode. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may be found in the dictionary.
Use the Omit property to hide the field during the Find/Entry/Change phases.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Fixed --------------------------------------------------------------
Permanently displays the current value for this field when the screen first appears.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Fixed property to indicate that the value of the screen is displayed when the screen first appears. This field is also not updatable by default unless forced through procedural code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Fixed --------------------------------------------------------------
Permanently displays the current value for this field when the screen first appears.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Fixed property to indicate that the value of the screen is displayed when the screen first appears. This field is also not updatable by default unless forced through procedural code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Silent -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that the field should not appear on the screen.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Silent property to hide a field on the screen. This option is used for processing purposes when used in conjunction with a block other fields.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Hidden -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that the field should be invisible on the screen.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the Hidden property to hide a field on the screen.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoChange -----------------------------------------------------------
Permits the user to only enter a value when in Entry mode.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoChange property to disallow the user from changing the value in this field for existing records. This field allows data entry when adding new records.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoCorrect ----------------------------------------------------------
States that once a value has been entered in Entry mode, it cannot be changed until the record has been saved.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoCorrect property to set the field to read-only during Correct mode. This means that once the Entry sequence has completed, this value cannot be changed until the record has been saved.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoEntry ------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that this field is read-only in Entry mode.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoEntry property in order to set this field to read-only during Entry mode.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoSelect -----------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that this field is read-only in Select (Find) mode.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoSelect property to set this field to read-only during Select (Find) mode.
The "ROFieldValue" class is used to set the style for this field.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PreDisplay ---------------------------------------------------------
Display any initial value for this field as soon as the screen appears, or if the mode is changed, or if the cluster is initialized.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the PreDisplay property to indicate that the value should be displayed as soon as the screen appears, when the mode is changed, or the cluster is initialized.
Assumed for ALL fields on a slave screen.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NoWarn -------------------------------------------------------------
Suppresses the display of messages.
One of the Boolean types. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
Use the NoWarn property to indicate that no messages should be displayed on the screen.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Default ------------------------------------------------------------
The default value to be used when in Entry mode and no item has previously been entered into the field.
A String containing the field's default value.
Use the Default property to set the value that is to be used as the default value for this field if the user doesn't enter anything into this field during Entry processing. If Required is also set to True, the Default option is ignored.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- EntryIf ------------------------------------------------------------
Field is required in Entry mode if the specified condition is met.
A String containing the condition to be met.
Use the EntryIf property to indicate that a value is to be entered into this field only if the current condition is met during Entry processing.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Pattern ------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies a string of characters and metacharacters that provides a general description of values.
A String containing the general description of values.
Use the Pattern property to st the string of characters and metacharacters that provides a pattern that the entered data must adhere to in order to be valid.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Picture ------------------------------------------------------------
Establishes the output picture to be used to format the item value for display.
A String containing the output picture format.
Use the Picture property to set the format that is to be used to display the value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Significance -------------------------------------------------------
Establishes the minimum number of decimal points to be displayed.
A String representing the number of decimal points.
Use the Significance property to set the minimum number of decimal points to be displayed. It is used to display leading non-substitution characters and leading zeros.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- UnderLyingDataType -------------------------------------------------
DataType of the underlying item (variable or element) for this field.
One of the DataTypes. The default value is "NotSet".
The datatype can be one of Character, Numeric or Date. The default value is initialized to "NotSet" meaning the property has not been set or the value may or may not be found in the dictionary.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This property indicates that the values was changed in the current field by the user. This property differs from the ValueChanged property in that ValueChanged stays persistent throughout the current mode, while this property is keeps it's value only until after the Validation is run. Once a new control has the Accept focus, this value is reset. This is used to determine whether to use the value from the Text property versus the SubmittedValue property.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Input event handles data conversion for a value entered prior to editing.
The Input event can be used to change the value (or lack of value) entered by the user. The predefined member variable FieldText is used to determine the value entered by the user, and this value can be changed prior to editing. This event is called after being prompted in a field based on the Accept or RequestPrompt method.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Output event handles performing data conversion prior to displaying the value in a field.
The Output event can be used to change data prior to displaying the value. This event is raised prior to the application of formatting options. It is raised in response to the Accept, RequestPrompt or Display methods. In order to change the value, the predefined member variable FieldText must be altered. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Process event performs processing after a value was entered.
The Process event is used to perform additional processing such as performing calculations and is initiated based on an entered value as a result of the Accept or Edit methods. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue (numeric or date fields) to update the current value. Referencing the underlying record buffers (ie. the value from the associated File class or Temporary class) is not recommended as the FieldText or FieldValue values have already been moved into those record buffers during the validation phase (as a result of the Accept or Edit methods), and may therefore not be current. The Process event is executed after the successful completion of the Edit event. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Edit event performs editing on a value in a field.
The Edit event can be is used to perform editing of values. This event is initiated as a result of being called during the validation process of the Edit method, or as a result of an entered or changed value entered in a field in response to the Accept method. During the processing phase of the Accept method, Edit event is raised if the predefined member variable FieldText is not empty at the end of the Input event. Default values also do not trigger the Edit event. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue to compare the current value with existing or old values. To access the old value, use the OldValue function.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The LookupOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value exists.
Use the LookupOn event to handle logic for checking if the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to not finding a matching value.
In the example below, if the MANAGER record is found, then the fleMANAGER class will now contain this record. This record will now be used when referencing a value from the fleMANAGER class until a new retrieval is performed.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" MANAGER.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
fleMANAGER.GetData(strSQL.ToString, GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
If Not AccessOk Then
Warning("This manager does not exist.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- LookupNotOn --------------------------------------------------------
The LookupNotOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value does not exist.
Use the LookupNotOn event to handle logic for checking that the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to finding a matching value.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim blnAlreadyExists As Boolean
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("SELECT EMPLOYEE_ID ")
strSQL.Append(" FROM ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE ")
strSQL.Append(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
Dim rdr As OracleDataReader = OracleHelper.ExecuteReader(m_trnTRANS_UPDATE, CommandType.Text, strSQL.ToString)
If rdr.Read OrElse Not LookupNotOn(fleEMPLOYEE, "EMPLOYEE_ID", FIELDTEXT) Then
blnAlreadyExists = True
End If
rdr.Close()
rdr.Dispose()
If blnAlreadyExists Then
ErrorMessage("This EMPLOYEE record already exists.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

Add Handler to PageLoadDictionaries Event
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Input event handles data conversion for a value entered prior to editing.
The Input event can be used to change the value (or lack of value) entered by the user. The predefined member variable FieldText is used to determine the value entered by the user, and this value can be changed prior to editing. This event is called after being prompted in a field based on the Accept or RequestPrompt method.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Output event handles performing data conversion prior to displaying the value in a field.
The Output event can be used to change data prior to displaying the value. This event is raised prior to the application of formatting options. It is raised in response to the Accept, RequestPrompt or Display methods. In order to change the value, the predefined member variable FieldText must be altered. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Process event performs processing after a value was entered.
The Process event is used to perform additional processing such as performing calculations and is initiated based on an entered value as a result of the Accept or Edit methods. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue (numeric or date fields) to update the current value. Referencing the underlying record buffers (ie. the value from the associated File class or Temporary class) is not recommended as the FieldText or FieldValue values have already been moved into those record buffers during the validation phase (as a result of the Accept or Edit methods), and may therefore not be current. The Process event is executed after the successful completion of the Edit event. Use the predefined member variable FieldText to alter the current value.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Edit event performs editing on a value in a field.
The Edit event can be is used to perform editing of values. This event is initiated as a result of being called during the validation process of the Edit method, or as a result of an entered or changed value entered in a field in response to the Accept method. During the processing phase of the Accept method, Edit event is raised if the predefined member variable FieldText is not empty at the end of the Input event. Default values also do not trigger the Edit event. Use the predefined member variables FieldText or FieldValue to compare the current value with existing or old values. To access the old value, use the OldValue function.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The LookupOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value exists.
Use the LookupOn event to handle logic for checking if the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to not finding a matching value.
In the example below, if the MANAGER record is found, then the fleMANAGER class will now contain this record. This record will now be used when referencing a value from the fleMANAGER class until a new retrieval is performed.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" MANAGER.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
fleMANAGER.GetData(strSQL.ToString, GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
If Not AccessOk Then
Warning("This manager does not exist.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- LookupNotOn --------------------------------------------------------
The LookupNotOn event handles logic for checking if the entered value does not exist.
Use the LookupNotOn event to handle logic for checking that the entered value exists. Logic must be added to raise an error in response to finding a matching value.
Private Sub fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID_LookupOn() Handles fldEMPLOYEE_MGR_ID.LookupOn
Try
Dim blnAlreadyExists As Boolean
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("SELECT EMPLOYEE_ID ")
strSQL.Append(" FROM ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE ")
strSQL.Append(" WHERE ")
strSQL.Append(" EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(FIELDTEXT))
Dim rdr As OracleDataReader = OracleHelper.ExecuteReader(m_trnTRANS_UPDATE, CommandType.Text, strSQL.ToString)
If rdr.Read OrElse Not LookupNotOn(fleEMPLOYEE, "EMPLOYEE_ID", FIELDTEXT) Then
blnAlreadyExists = True
End If
rdr.Close()
rdr.Dispose()
If blnAlreadyExists Then
ErrorMessage("This EMPLOYEE record already exists.")
End If
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
GetSessionInformation returns the Session Information for the passed NumberedSessionID.
SessionID is string (usually a GUID). If passed SessionID found, it returns UserID of the user.
If passed SessionID found, it returns date and time when the session is enlisted in Session Manager Service.
If passed SessionID found, it returns most recent Time(rather DateTime) when the session is accessed.
If passed SessionID found, it whether a session is active or not, based on LastAccessTime and TimeOut as specified in App.config of Session Manager Service.
If passed SessionID found, return an integer representing an ID for the session.
True if session information is found (regardless whether session is still active or not) in Session Manager Service, otherwise returns False.
To check whether Session is active or not one should check IsActive rather than Return Value.
[mayur] 3/30/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
GetSessionInformation returns the Session Information for the passed NumberedSessionID.
An integer representing an ID for the session. If passed NumberedSessionID found, it returns UserID of the user.
If passed NumberedSessionID found, it returns date and time when the session is enlisted in Session Manager Service.
If passed NumberedSessionID found, it returns most recent Time(rather DateTime) when the session is accessed.
If passed NumberedSessionID found, it whether a session is active or not, based on LastAccessTime and TimeOut as specified in App.config of Session Manager Service.
If passed NumberedSessionID found, returns corresponding string of SessionID.
True if session information is found (regardless whether session is still active or not) in Session Manager Service, otherwise returns False.
To check whether Session is active or not one should check IsActive rather than Return Value.
[mayur] 3/30/2005 Created

--- m_oldTextField ------------------------------------------------------
Stores the field that had the OldText value updated. This is so we can set the OldText back if we hit a RunScreen since when we hit a RunScreen and we go back to the ASPX, we don't update the fields on the form. For this reason the OldText is updated and when compared to the posted value, will cause the posted value to be updated. This field will allow us to reset the OldText value if we hit a RunScreen.
[Chris] 01-Apr-2009 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- m_oldTextValue ------------------------------------------------------
Stores the value in OldText prior to being updated. This is so we can set the OldText back if we hit a RunScreen since when we hit a RunScreen and we go back to the ASPX, we don't update the fields on the form. For this reason the OldText is updated and when compared to the posted value, will cause the posted value to be updated.
[Chris] 01-Apr-2009 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

Calls the Accept/Edit verb for each of the fields on the screen in order to validate the data entered.
The UpdateValidation method is generated by the Renaissance Architect PreCompiler for screens that have the UseAcceptProcessing property set to False. This method ensures that the values entered are validated and run through the proper phases (Input, Edit, Process, Output). Screens where UseAcceptProcessing is set to False have to re-run through the Accept/Edit verbs as the user is not forced through the proper sequence since the user can skip from one field to any other field. Accept processing forces the user through the sequence defined by the associated method (Entry, Designer 01, etc.).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Calls the Accept/Edit verb for each of the grid fields on the screen in order to validate the data entered.
The GridUpdateValidation method is generated by the Renaissance Architect PreCompiler for screens that have the UseAcceptProcessing property set to False. This method ensures that the values entered are validated and run through the proper phases (Input, Edit, Process, Output). Screens where UseAcceptProcessing is set to False have to re-run through the Accept/Edit verbs as the user is not forced through the proper sequence since the user can skip from one field to any other field. Accept processing forces the user through the sequence defined by the associated method (Append, Designer 01, etc.).
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created

--- HasPathRequestFields -----------------------------------------------
This property indicates that the current screen has fields that are prompted for during the Find sequence.
This property is used by the framework to perform certain actions, and is generated by the Renaissance Architect Wizard or Renaissance Architect Forward Engineering component.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- RequireSelectProcessing --------------------------------------------
Subject to "Display" property enables or disables Fields in "Find" mode for search criteria
Rules to follow when using this property:
Set it to "Disable" to disable Select Processing on a form.
To enable Select Processing only on Primary (not to be confused with Primary File) Area of the screen set it to "OnPrimary"
To enable Select Processing on Primary as well as on Grid fields (In case of Primary/Detail screen) set it to "OnPrimaryAndGrid"
To enable only Grid Fields, set this property to "OnPrimaryAndGrid", set "Display" Property of individual NonGrid Fields such that it disables the field in Find Mode e.g. Find, EntryFind or EntryChangeFind.
Setting this property to "OnPrimaryAndGrid" on a screen, which has no Core Grid Control on it, will behave same way as setting it to "OnPrimary" In short, setting this property to other than "Disable" will halt for user input when user click on "Find" toolbar button, regardless whether user has any Field enabled for entering search criteria or not.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- DisableAppendFromEntry --------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a boolean value indicating that the automatic call to the Append method from the Entry method is to be disabled.
Setting DisableAppendFromEntry to True will bypass the automatic call of the Append method when executing the Entry method.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------
