--- IsMenuScreen -------------------------------------------------------
Get or sets a value indicating that the current screen is a screen of type menu.
This property is used by the framework in order to perform specific actions that are specific to menu screens.
This property is only applicable when the screen is a menu screen and is not part of the menu tree. This property should be set in the Init method of the page.
Me.IsMenuScreen = True
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- FileForRecordStatus ------------------------------------------------
Returns the primary file object.
AlteredRecord, DeletedRecord and NewRecord uses m_bfoFileForRecordStatus to return the primary file unless it is changed with the SET ASSUMED (Which we don't support at present) statement. If there is no assumed record-structure, the status is the same as that of the current record-structure, that gets set in GetData.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AccessOk -----------------------------------------------------------
Indicates whether the last retrieval succeeded or failed.
AccessOK will return True if the last retrieval succeeded, and False if it failed. This property relates to a session and not to a specific screen, meaning that if the last retrieval was on another screen, and this property is referenced in the current screen, the value returned will be based on that retrieval.
This property is usually used while retrieving records optionally, and is used to determine whether records were found.
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
If AccessOk Then
T_EMP_EXISTS.Value = "Y" End If
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Push ---------------------------------------------------------------
Places one or more commands on the screen's pending buffer.
The designer procedure to place on the screen's pending buffer.
This method puts one or more commands on the pending buffer. Once the user has finished executing a specific procedure, the pending buffer is checked for the commands to execute.
The Push method has a First In First Out configuration. The following will be executed as follows:
Push(PushTypes.NextRecord)
Push(PushTypes.Find)
In the example listed above, the Find will be executed first, then the NextRecord command.
Push(dsrDesigner_BAT)

--- Accept -------------------------------------------------------------
Prompts the user for a value.
The field for which the user will be prompted.
The Accept method prompts the user for a value, checks and edits this value, stores this value in the associated record buffer (the variable or file object related to the field) and then displays the formatted value.
The Accept method performs several processing steps. They are as follows:
1. The user is prompted for input.
If there is a value in the field, the current value is highlighted.
The entered value or null value is then assigned to the predefined variable FieldText.
If the field is of type Character, then the Upshift or Downshift is applied if specified.
2. The Input event associated to this field is then executed if applicable.
This event can be used to change the value of FieldText.
3. If the FieldText size is 0, then the m_blnPromptOk member is set to False indicating no value was entered or substituted in the Input event.
This value is set to True if the user entered a value or a value was set during the Input event.
The rest of this step is ignored and execution resumes at step 8 if the m_blnPromptOK member is set to False and the Required,
Duplicate or Default properties are not set.
The duplicate buffer is assigned the value of FieldText.
Fields of type Numeric are checked for numbers and scaled by the input scale (if scaling is turned on).
Date fields are checked for a proper date.
The FieldValue predefined variable is then assigned with the numeric value of FieldText if this field
is of type Numeric or Date.
4. Dictionary editing is performed on FieldText (for fields of type Character) and FieldValue (for fields of type Numeric or Date).
This editing is as follows:
The value is checked to ensure that it is within the range of possible values (if applicable) as specified in the FieldValues property.
The value is checked to ensure that it matches the Pattern as specified in the Pattern property.
The LookupOn and LookupNotOn events are initiated to check if the value is found or not found on the specified files.
The OldValue function can be used to determine the value in the record buffer of the associated item.
5. The Edit event associated to this field is then executed if applicable. Use the FieldText (Character) or FieldValue (for Numeric and Date fields)
predefined items to change the value if necessary. This value will be re-assigned to the underlying record buffers in the next step.
6. The value is assigned to the associated record buffer (the associated variable or file object) and in the duplicate record buffer.
7. The Process event associated to this field is executed if applicable. This event can be used to to perform processing or data manipulation
on the changed item.
8. The value is retrieved from the associated record buffer for display purposes. The value is placed in FieldText. Numeric items are scaled by
the output scale (if scaling is turned on) prior to being placed in FieldText and are right justified. A Date item is placed in FieldText as a number,
without the separator.
9. The associated Output event is execute if applicable.
This event can be used to reformat the FieldText value prior to the final formatting options being applied. 10. For Numeric fields, numeric formatting is applied including the application of the Picture property. Date fields are formatted using the
specified date format. Character fields are formatted under the control of the Picture property. The value is then displayed in the field.
Accept(fldEMPLOYEE_EMPLOYEE_NAME)
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

3. If the FieldText size is 0, then the m_blnPromptOk member is set to False indicating no value was entered or substituted in the Input event.
This value is set to True if the user entered a value or a value was set during the Input event.
The rest of this step is ignored and execution resumes at step 8 if the m_blnPromptOK member is set to False and the Required,
Duplicate or Default properties are not set.
The duplicate buffer is assigned the value of FieldText.
Fields of type Numeric are checked for numbers and scaled by the input scale (if scaling is turned on).
Date fields are checked for a proper date.
The FieldValue predefined variable is then assigned with the numeric value of FieldText if this field
is of type Numeric or Date.
4. The value is assigned to the associated record buffer (the associated variable or file object) and in the duplicate record buffer.
5. The value is retrieved from the associated record buffer for display purposes. The value is placed in FieldText. Numeric items are scaled by
the output scale (if scaling is turned on) prior to being placed in FieldText and are right justified. A Date item is placed in FieldText as a number,
without the separator.
6. The associated Output event is execute if applicable.
This event can be used to reformat the FieldText value prior to the final formatting options being applied. 7. For Numeric fields, numeric formatting is applied including the application of the Picture property. Date fields are formatted using the
specified date format. Character fields are formatted under the control of the Picture property. The value is then displayed in the field.
RequestPrompt(fldEMPLOYEE_EMPLOYEE_NAME)
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Edit ---------------------------------------------------------------
Edits a value in a field.
The field for which the value will be edited.
The Edit method performs value checking, initiates the LookupOn and LookupNotOn events and executes the associated Edit and Process events for the named field.
The Edit method performs the following processing steps:
1. Dictionary editing is performed on FieldText (for fields of type Character) and FieldValue (for fields of type Numeric or Date).
This editing is as follows:
The value is checked to ensure that it is within the range of possible values (if applicable) as specified in the FieldValues property.
The value is checked to ensure that it matches the Pattern as specified in the Pattern property.
The LookupOn and LookupNotOn events are initiated to check if the value is found or not found on the specified files.
The OldValue function can be used to determine the value in the record buffer of the associated item.
2. The Edit event associated to this field is then executed if applicable. Use the FieldText (Character) or FieldValue (for Numeric and Date fields)
predefined items to change the value if necessary. This value will be re-assigned to the underlying record buffers in the next step.
3. The Process event associated to this field is executed if applicable. This event can be used to to perform processing or data manipulation
on the changed item.
Edit(fldEMPLOYEE_EMPLOYEE_BENEFIT)
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AddMessage ---------------------------------------------------------

[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AddMessage ---------------------------------------------------------
Adds messages to the current collection.
A collection of Messages.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AddMessage ---------------------------------------------------------
Adds a message to the current Message Collection.
A string containing a specific message. A MessageType describing the type of message. An array of message parameters.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ErrorMessage -------------------------------------------------------
Adds an Error message to the message collection.
A string containing a specific Error Message. An array of message parameters.
The ErrorMessage method stops execution and displays an error on the screen.
This method will stop code execution and will reprompt at the last executed Accept method if applicable. A message will then be displayed in the messagebar area. NOTE: The ErrorMessage method will cause the screen to close when called from the Intialize method.
ErrorMessage("The value you entered is not a valid status type.")
ErrorMessage("The value at row " + Occurrence + " is incorrect.")
The following syntax is used when substituting values in error messages that are in the globalization dll:
Globalization value is "Employee {0} has exceeded his allowable expense limit of {1}"
ErrorMessage("MSG0001", fleEMPLOYEE.GetStringValue("EMPLOYEE_NAME"), T_TEMP.Value)
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Information --------------------------------------------------------
Adds an Information message to the message collection.
A string containing a specific Error Message. An array of message parameters.
The Information method displays a information message to the user.
Information("A record will be added to the Employee table.")
Information("The value at row " + Occurrence + " will be used.")
The following syntax is used when substituting values in messages that are in the globalization dll:
Globalization value is "Employee {0} has exceeded his allowable expense limit of {1}"
Information("MSG0001", fleEMPLOYEE.GetStringValue("EMPLOYEE_NAME"), T_TEMP.Value)

--- ResetBindGridFieldsFlag --------------------------------------------
Resets the Bind Grid Fields Flag.
Setting this flag to "False" limits the use of Grid Fields directly or indirectly inside the "For"/"ForMissing" method in "Find, PostFind, DetailFind and DetailPostfind" methods i.e. Grid Fields will not be accessible inside the "For"/"ForMissing" loop in "Find, PostFind, DetailFind and DetailPostfind" methods.

member.name: M:Core.Windows.UI.Core.Windows.UI.Page.FnKeyExecuted
member.summary: FnKeyExecuted returns true if a function key has been executed for a field. This was coded for the COLONIAL so that they could run Designer procedures while in a field. By default Designer procedures are disabled while in a field as in PowerHouse they would not be able to execute a Designer unless they are in the action field.
member.returns: A boolean indicating a function key is executed for the current accept.

--- GetData ------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve data from the database.
Use this method if you ever need to pass a complete SQL statement with GetDataBehaviour.
Don't use this construct to generate Overrided SQL Statement internally. i.e. Use this method if you ever need to pass GetDataBehaviour other than GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect.
To pass GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect use another method, if you need to pass Where Clause and Order By clause along with Auto Overrided SQL e.g. GetData(WhereClause, OrderByClause, GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect)
If you pass OverrideSQL along with GetDataBehaviour = GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect this method will use passed OverrideSQL, completely ignoring the GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect
The first parameter "IsOverrided" is added to add overloaded method Passing it as false has NO impact, i.e. whether you pass True or False this function will treat it as True.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- GetData ------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve data from the database.
Use this method if you ever need to pass a complete SQL statement with GetDataBehaviour.
Don't use this construct to generate Overrided SQL Statement internally. i.e. Use this method if you ever need to pass GetDataBehaviour other than GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect.
To pass GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect use another method, if you need to pass Where Clause and Order By clause along with Auto Overrided SQL e.g. GetData(WhereClause, OrderByClause, GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect)
If you pass OverrideSQL along with GetDataBehaviour = GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect this method will use passed OverrideSQL, completely ignoring the GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect
The first parameter "IsOverrided" is added to add overloaded method Passing it as false has NO impact, i.e. whether you pass True or False this function will treat it as True.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NestedFor ----------------------------------------------------------
Repeats a group of statements within another repeating control structure.
A string value generated by the Renaissance Architect PreCompiler to uniquely identify this control structure. An integer value indicating the number of times to repeat the group of statements.
The NestedFor method is used to handle For controls structures being called within For control structures. The RenaissanceArchitect PreCompiler will generate a unique ForID parameter. This function ensures that the Occurrence is reset properly upon completion or breaking out of this control structure.
Do While Me.NestedFor("1", 10)
If T_TEMP.Value = 5 Then
Me.Break: Exit Do
End If
Loop
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Break --------------------------------------------------------------
Breaks out of executing a group of statements during a For loop.
Use the Break verb to break out of executing a group of statements when a condition is met.
Always use the break verb followed by the Exit Do verb as specified in the example.
Do While Me.NestedFor(10)
If T_TEMP.Value = 5 Then
Me.Break: Exit Do
End If
Loop
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Break --------------------------------------------------------------
Breaks out of executing a group of statements during a NestedFor loop.
Use the Break verb to break out of executing a group of statements when a condition is met.
Always use the break verb followed by the Exit Do verb as specified in the example.
Do While Me.NestedFor("1", 10)
If T_TEMP.Value = 5 Then
Me.Break("1"): Exit Do
End If
Loop
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AddDateFunction --------------------------------------------------
Wraps the date field within the appropriate date function code.
The field to add the function around.

1. AddDateFunction("EMPLOYEE.START_DATE") will return " TO_NUMBER(TO_CHAR(EMPLOYEE.START_DATE, 'YYYYMMDD'))"

--- GetWhereCondition --------------------------------------------------
Generates a string value containing a SQL WHERE clause.
The name of the field in the SQL statement. The value to assign to the field. Indicates that this is the first field in the WHERE clause and the keyword WHERE is to be appended.
Returns a formatted SQL Where Condition by concatenating the parameters FieldName and Value. This function will return nothing if the passed Value is a null date (01/01/0001). or space.
This function should only be used in the Find procedure.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- GetWhereCondition --------------------------------------------------
Generates a string value containing a SQL WHERE clause.
The name of the field in the SQL statement. The value to assign to the field. Indicates that this is the first field in the WHERE clause and the keyword WHERE is to be appended. This is passed in using a variable. Set this to True if we are passing a blank value (constant).
Returns a formatted SQL Where Condition by concatenating the parameters FieldName and Value and substituting the wildcard character (@) and creating a LIKE clause. This function will return nothing if the passed Value is blank unless IsBlankLiteral is set to true. or space.
1. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "AABB", blnAddWhere) will return " WHERE RegionCode = 'AABB'"
2. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "AABB") will return " AND RegionCode = 'AABB'"
3. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "@") will return " AND RegionCode LIKE '%'"
4. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "%", blnAddWhere) will return " WHERE RegionCode LIKE '%'"
5. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", " ", blnAddWhere, True) will return " WHERE RegionCode = ' ' Or RegionCode IS NULL"
This function should only be used in the Find procedure.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This member supports the Renaissance Architect Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
[Chris] 05/04/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

--- AcceptProcessingOldText --------------------------------------------
The AcceptProcessingOldText value of the Textbox (static until designer completion).
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ItemSize ----------------------------------------------------------
The item size of the value of the TextBox.
An Integer representing the size of the value. The default value is 0 indicating the property is not set.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Highlight -----------------------------------------------------------
Summary of Highlight.
The Highlight property of the Textbox.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- RightJustify -------------------------------------------------------
Contains the value whether to Right Justify the text within the control.
One of the BooleanTypes. The default value is "NotSet" meaning the value will not be right justified.
Use the RightJustify property to set the alignment of the text contained in the TextBox to be right justified.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PopupHeight --------------------------------------------------------
The height of the Textbox popup window.
An Integer representing the height of the popup window.
A popup is only created if the PopupWidth or PopupHeight of the control is > 0.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PopupWidth ---------------------------------------------------------
The width of the Textbox popup window.
An Integer representing the width of the popup window.
A popup is only created if the PopupWidth or PopupHeight of the control is > 0.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PopupLeft ----------------------------------------------------------
The left location of the TextBox popup window.
An Integer representing the left location of the popup window.
A popup is only created if the PopupWidth or PopupHeight of the control is > 0.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PopupTop -----------------------------------------------------------
The top location of the TextBox popup window.
An Integer representing the top location of the popup window.
A popup is only created if the PopupWidth or PopupHeight of the control is > 0.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Decimal ------------------------------------------------------------
The Decimal Value of the TextBox.
An Integer representing a decimal value.
Use the Decimal property when using calculations requiring large numbers of significant integral and fractional digits and no round-off errors.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- LookupCharacter ----------------------------------------------------
The character to be used to invoke a lookup screen.
A String representing a character to invoke a lookup screen.
If specified, this character will be used to invoke a lookup screen, otherwise it will use the default character specified in the application.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- UseLookupCharacter -------------------------------------------------
Determines whether to use a lookup character to call a lookup screen or not.
A Boolean indicating whether to use a character for lookup screen. The default value is set to "False".
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- LoadDefaultsFromDictionary -----------------------------------------
Summary of LoadDefaultsFromDictionary.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- PrepareForDisplayInGrid --------------------------------------------
Summary of PrepareForDisplayInGrid.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Class : CoreVarChar
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This class defines the Renaissance Architect Framework CoreVarChar.
The Renaissance Architect implementation of CoreVarChar handles Temporary (variable) objects of type VarChar.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreVarChar.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreVarChar. The current page of type Core.Windows.UI.Page. Use the keyword "Me" to set this value. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a screen or sub-screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me)
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreVarChar.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreVarChar. The current page of type Core.Windows.UI.Page. Use the keyword "Me" to set this value. A ResetType indicating when objects value should be reset. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a screen or sub-screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me, ResetTypes.ResetAtStartup)
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreVarChar.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreVarChar. The current page of type Core.Windows.UI.Page. Use the keyword "Me" to set this value. An Integer representing the number of times this CoreVarChar occurs in Grid. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a screen or sub-screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me, 6)
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreVarChar.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreVarChar. The current page of type Core.Windows.UI.Page. Use the keyword "Me" to set this value. An Integer representing the number of times this CoreVarChar occurs in Grid. A ResetType indicating when objects value should be reset. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a screen or sub-screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me, 6, ResetTypes.ResetAtStartup)
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreVarChar.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreVarChar. The current page of type Core.Windows.UI.Page. Use the keyword "Me" to set this value. A FileObject which CoreVarChar occurs with. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a screen or sub-screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me, fleCOMPANY)
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreVarChar.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreVarChar. The current page of type Core.Windows.UI.Page. Use the keyword "Me" to set this value. A CoreBaseType which CoreVarChar occurs with. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a screen or sub-screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me, strCOMPANY)
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Value --------------------------------------------------------------
The value of the current CoreVarChar instance.
A String representing the value of the CoreVarChar.
Dim myVAR_CHAR as CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("myVAR_CHAR", 4, Me)
If myVAR_CHAR.Value = "YES" Then . . End if
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- NullValue ----------------------------------------------------------
Used to see if CoreVarChar is empty.
One space if the trimed valued is an empty string.
NullValue should only be used when trailing spaces are not required.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- InitialValue -------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the Initial Value of the CoreVarChar.
A String representing the initial value of the CoreVarChar.
Dim myVAR_CHAR as CoreVarChar = New CoreVarChar("myVAR_CHAR", 4, Me)
myVAR_CHAR.InitialValue = 10
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ResetInitialValues -------------------------------------------------
Resets the initial value based on the datatype.
Note: Called only from ghost screens for improved performance.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ResetInitialValues -------------------------------------------------
Resets the initial value.
The value to assign as the initial value
Note: Called only from ghost screens for improved performance.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Push ---------------------------------------------------------------
Places one or more commands on the screen's pending buffer.
The designer procedure to place on the screen's pending buffer.
This method puts one or more commands on the pending buffer. Once the user has finished executing a specific procedure, the pending buffer is checked for the commands to execute.
The Push method has a First In First Out configuration. The following will be executed as follows:
Push(PushTypes.NextRecord)
Push(PushTypes.Find)
In the example listed above, the Find will be executed first, then the NextRecord command.
Push(dsrDesigner_BAT)
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ErrorMessage -------------------------------------------------------

The ErrorMessage method stops execution and displays an error on the screen.

ErrorMessage("The value at row " + Occurrence + " is incorrect.")
The following syntax is used when substituting values in error messages that are in the globalization dll:

--- GetWhereClauseString --------------------------------------------------
Generates a string value containing a SQL WHERE clause.
The first field in the SQL statement. The Operator value. The second field in the SQL statement
Indicates that this is the first field in the WHERE clause and the keyword WHERE is to be appended. This is passed in using a variable.
Returns a formatted SQL WHERE CLAUSE by concatenating the parameters Field1, Operator and Field2 for date fields to ensure that fields with a NULL are also returned if necessary.
1. GetWhereClauseString("EMPLOYEE.START_DATE", "=", 0, True) will return " WHERE EMPLOYEE.START_DATE IS NULL"
2. GetWhereClauseString("EMPLOYEE.START_DATE", "<", 19991231, True) will return " WHERE (EMPLOYEE.START_DATE IS NULL OR TO_NUMBER(TO_CHAR(EMPLOYEE.START_DATE,'YYYYMMDD')) < 19991231)"
3. GetWhereClauseString(19991231, ">", "EMPLOYEE.START_DATE", True) will return " WHERE (19991231 > (TO_NUMBER(TO_CHAR(EMPLOYEE.START_DATE,'YYYYMMDD')) OR EMPLOYEE.START_DATE IS NULL)"
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- GetData ------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve data from the database.
Use this method if you ever need to pass a complete SQL statement with GetDataBehaviour.
Don't use this construct to generate Overrided SQL Statement internally. i.e. Use this method if you ever need to pass GetDataBehaviour other than GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect.
To pass GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect use another method, if you need to pass Where Clause and Order By clause along with Auto Overrided SQL e.g. GetData(WhereClause, OrderByClause, GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect)
If you pass OverrideSQL along with GetDataBehaviour = GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect this method will use passed OverrideSQL, completely ignoring the GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect
The first parameter "IsOverrided" is added to add overloaded method Passing it as false has NO impact, i.e. whether you pass True or False this function will treat it as True.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- GetData ------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieve data from the database.
Use this method if you ever need to pass a complete SQL statement with GetDataBehaviour.
Don't use this construct to generate Overrided SQL Statement internally. i.e. Use this method if you ever need to pass GetDataBehaviour other than GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect.
To pass GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect use another method, if you need to pass Where Clause and Order By clause along with Auto Overrided SQL e.g. GetData(WhereClause, OrderByClause, GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect)
If you pass OverrideSQL along with GetDataBehaviour = GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect this method will use passed OverrideSQL, completely ignoring the GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect
The first parameter "IsOverrided" is added to add overloaded method Passing it as false has NO impact, i.e. whether you pass True or False this function will treat it as True.
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- GetWhereCondition --------------------------------------------------
Generates a string value containing a SQL WHERE clause.
The name of the field in the SQL statement. The value to assign to the field.
Indicates that this is the first field in the WHERE clause and the keyword WHERE is to be appended.
Returns a formatted SQL Where Condition by concatenating the parameters FieldName and Value. This function will return nothing if the passed Value is a null date (01/01/0001). or space.
This function should only be used in the Find procedure.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- GetWhereCondition --------------------------------------------------
Generates a string value containing a SQL WHERE clause.
The name of the field in the SQL statement. The value to assign to the field.
Indicates that this is the first field in the WHERE clause and the keyword WHERE is to be appended. This is passed in using a variable.
Set this to True if we are passing a blank value (constant).
Returns a formatted SQL Where Condition by concatenating the parameters FieldName and Value and substituting the wildcard character (@) and creating a LIKE clause. This function will return nothing if the passed Value is blank unless IsBlankLiteral is set to true. or space.
1. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "AABB", blnAddWhere) will return " WHERE RegionCode = 'AABB'"
2. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "AABB") will return " AND RegionCode = 'AABB'"
3. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "@") will return " AND RegionCode LIKE '%'"
4. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", "%", blnAddWhere) will return " WHERE RegionCode LIKE '%'"
5. GetWhereCondition("RegionCode", " ", blnAddWhere, True) will return " WHERE RegionCode = ' ' Or RegionCode IS NULL"
This function should only be used in the Find procedure.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- OldValue -----------------------------------------------------------
Returns the value of the underlying record buffer during editing.
A String containing the name of field. A String containing the current value of field.
The OldValue function returns the current item in the underlying record buffer. If the value passed in as value is not found, then this value is returned in case OldValue is used on a field that is not currently executing the Edit procedure.
OldValue can should only be used during the Edit procedure to return the value in the associated record buffer. FieldText or FieldValue are used to handle the new value associated to this field.
T_TEMP.Value = OldValue("SURNAME", "Smith")
[Campbell] 7/4/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : Core.Windows.UI Class : Core.Windows.OracleFileObject
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Identifies and describes an Oracle record-structure accessed by the screen.
This class contains the properties, methods, events and members that provide the functionality to identify and describe an Oracle record-structure (FileObject) accessed by the screen.
[Campbell] 4/12/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes a new instance of an OracleFileObject class.
Required A reference to the current menu/ghost screen class set using the keyword 'Me'. Required A type of file as defined in FileTypes. Required An integer representing the number of occurrences of a record-structure to display. Required A string specifying the owner of the table. Required Base relation name (underlying table if aliased) Required Alias name of table. Optional No Items (no default initialization occurs) Optional No Append method is generated for this file (PRIMARY only) Optional No DeletedRecord is generated in the Delete or DetailDelete methods for this file Optional This option can be used to add blank data records or data records with initial and final values only. (PutData method treats record as changed) Optional A string representing a Transaction Name. This is used by the Renaissance Architect PreCompiler to generate the necessary transaction code for this File class.
Private WithEvents fleEMP_LKP As New OracleFileObject(Me, FileTypes.Reference, 0, "HRMAIN", "EMPLOYEE", "EMP_LKP", False, False, False, 0, "m_trnTRANS_UPDATE")
[Campbell] 4/12/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes a new instance of an OracleFileObject class.
Required A reference to the current menu/ghost screen class set using the keyword 'Me'. Required A type of file as defined in FileTypes. Class : CoreCharacter
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This class defines the Renaissance Architect Framework CoreCharacter.
The Renaissance Architect implementation of CoreCharacter handles Temporary (variable) objects of type Character.
[Campbell] 6/22/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Instantiates a new instance of CoreCharacter.
A String containing the name of the object. An Integer indicating the size of CoreCharacter. An object of type BaseClassControl. OptionalA String representing the initial value of the object.
This constructor can be used only in a menu or ghost screen.
Dim EMPLOYEE_NAME As CoreCharacter = New CoreCharacter("EMPLOYEE_NAME", 20, Me)
